thread.title: EastEnders crisis as Danny Dyer's forced exit destroys major storylines as Whitney Carter 'falls pregnant with Mick's baby'
thread.title_full: EastEnders crisis as Danny Dyer's forced exit destroys major storylines as Whitney Carter 'falls pregnant with Mick's baby'

title: EastEnders crisis as Danny Dyer's forced exit destroys major storylines as Whitney Carter 'falls pregnant with Mick's baby'
text:
Comments DANNY Dyer’s exit from EastEnders has plunged the show into chaos with major storylines being affected. 
The actor – who plays Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter in the BBC soap – has been forced to take a break from the show and with his character featuring in major storylines , the show is in crisis. BBC Press Handout 11 Danny’s character Mick is one of the main cast members and has huge storylines coming up 
Strong storylines about the Carter family’s future are now in peril as Danny takes a break, while the Daily Star claims Whitney will become pregnant by Mick after their feelings for each other bubble over. 
Pictures taken of actress Shona McGarty appeared to confirm the rumours as she was spotted walking to a nightclub set hiding her stomach from the cameras. 
Viewers know how Whitney cheated on her husband Lee with Mick after waking up after being being run over by a bus, and he had previously kissed her before her wedding to Lee. 
Now the soap has been plunged into chaos with Danny no longer being available to film for episodes he was meant to appear in. Whitney and Mick’s feelings are growing by the day Whitney Carter cheats on husband Lee with his own DAD in EastEnders 
A Walford insider said: “Having Danny off is a total nightmare - it causes total chaos for both the writers and producers. 
“The storylines are worked out months in advance and no one was expecting him to be off. A lot of scripts had to be torn up and it’s caused a lot of behind-the-scenes chaos. It’s all anyone is talking about on set.” 
The party animal actor has stopped filming after talks with show bosses and is expected to be off work for a number of weeks, say insiders. Fame Flynet BBC bosses are reportedly concerned about Danny Dyer after he was visibly drunk at the National Television Awards, and he has stopped filming the show Fame Flynet 11 Here's looking at you . . . Danny Dyer with beer and fag after a showbiz bash 
They were especially concerned about his behaviour at the National Television Awards , where he fell off the wagon after an attempt to quit alcohol at the start of the year. Danny, who plays Mick Carter on EastEnders, talks to The Sun at the NTA 
An insider on EastEnders said: “The producers are concerned about him for a number of reasons. 
“It was clear to onlookers he appeared very drunk at the NTAs. It is best that he takes some time out to sort his life out. He appears to be exhausted. Rex Features Well known drinker . . . Danny on Saturday Kitchen swigging from glass of wine BBC 11 Enders producers are reportedly concerned about Danny, who plays pub landlord Mick Carter 
“As a result, Danny is not filming on the show at all. There is an enforced break that is expected to last a number of weeks. 
“At the end of the day, he remains the biggest star of the show — so everyone is determined to get him back to his best.”
